definition: the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: I had no intention of going into the whys and the wherefores of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我无意深入调查这一情况的来龙去脉。

sentences.english: Bruce took me under his wing and taught me the ins and outs of the business.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯把我招到其翼下并教我商业运作的来龙去脉。

sentences.english: We are valuating and looking to understand what happened.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在评估和试图了解整件事情的来龙去脉。

sentences.english: Fifth, it is best to give context and explain what you are issuing a refutation to.
sentences.chinese: 第五，最好为你的辩驳提供来龙去脉。

sentences.english: She woke her husband and told him.
sentences.chinese: 她喊醒了丈夫，把事情的来龙去脉告诉他。

definition: cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
to figure out how to do something
variant of 緣由|缘由[yuan2 you2]
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
to get to the heart of the matter
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
to make sense of/to grasp the meaning of/to figure out
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
